She has worked with Manuela Ramos for six years. Her first loan, which was in the amount of 300 PEN, was invested in her business of selling food.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, Juana will buy supplies such as potatoes, chuo (freeze-dried potatoes), trout, cheese, lamb, and other items. Her children help with operating the business. Juanas husband is in the military and works in the north.

Her dream is to open a restaurant that serves different regional foods to tourists. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the good service provided by the staff.

loan.use: to purchase potatoes, chuo (freeze-dried potatoes), trout, cheese, lamb, and other items.

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos vive en la zona 5to anillo la cuidad de Santa Cruz, en casa familiar, en la cual vive con sus hijos y su esposa la Sra. Yeini. El Sr.se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano, cuenta con un vehculo propio el cual fue adquirido con su esfuerzo propio, adems de esto tambin tiene conocimiento de mecnica automotriz, su esposa es ama de casa, el fin del prstamo ser invertido para hacerle un buen mantenimiento a su vehculo ya que el hace muchos viajes a las provincias y desea que este en buen estado as para brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, es un apersona muy trabajadora a gradecido con la institucin por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Santa Cruzs 5th Ring in the family home with his wife, Yeini, and their children. He provides urban transportation services. He has a car that he acquired through his own efforts. He also knows auto mechanics. His wifes a housewife.
The loan will be used to do a thorough maintenance repair on his car because he does many trips out to the countryside and he wants it to be in good condition to provide better service for his customers. He is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loan.use: to service his car.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 aos de edad, est casada y tiene 4 hijos an estudiando. Julia solo estudi la primaria. Junto a su esposo, la seora se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacunos, ovinos, tambin se dedica a venta de granos de la Regin como quinua y caihua. Hace poco que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella requiere un prstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizar para comprar tres arrobas de quinua, caihua para venderlo en Ilo. En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien trabaja haciendo transporte en mototaxi en Puno. Su sueo es tener una tienda de abarrotes y abastecerla con todos los insumos necesarios. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del prstamo.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medallion) located in the Pomata district in Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 38-years-old, married, and has four children who are still in school. Julia only attended primary school. Alongside her husband, she works raising animals such as cattle and sheep and also works selling grains from the region like quinoa and caihua (a nutritious grain closely related to quinoa).
A little while ago she worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She needs a loan for 300 nuevo soles. This is money that she will use to buy three sackfuls (11.5 kilograms each) of quinoa and caihua to sell in Ilo. In the business her children help her and her husband, who works with a mototaxi in Puno, helps her also.
What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of getting loans.

loan.use: to buy three sackfuls (11.5 kilograms each) of quinoa and caihua (a nutritious grain closely related to quinoa).

loan.name: Kelly Norca

texts.es: Kelly es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 aos de edad, est casada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Kelly tiene educacin universitaria (incompleta). Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres aos, su prstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, lo invirti en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y golosinas, tambin tiene una librera, internet, locutorio y ofrece el servicio de recargas de movistar y claro. Con su nuevo prstamo de S/.1000.00 nuevo soles invertir en la compra de productos, vveres para implementar la tienda como mantequilla, Quaquer, cereales, chocolates. Nos cuenta que en el negocio le ayuda su esposo. Su sueo es ser empresaria en su negocio y vender al por mayor. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas, el compaerismo entre las socias y la facilidad del prstamo complementario.
texts.en:
Kelly is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) communal bank located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. Shes 29 years old, married and has a school age son. Kelly completed university.
Shes been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last three years. Her initial loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her grocery and snack business. She also has a stationery shop, Internet access service and a phone booth. She also sells recharges for Movistar and Claro (telecommunications companies).
She will use her new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy merchandise and foodstuffs to stock her store like butter, Quaker, cereals and chocolates. She comments that her husband helps her in the store.
Her dream is to become a large businesswoman in her line of word and a wholesaler.
What she likes about the communal bank is the chats, the companionship among the members and the ease of the loan.

loan.use: to buy butter, Quaker, cereals and chocolates.

loan.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 17 aos de edad, administra un negocio en el que trabaja su esposa y tambin sus hijos ofreciendo productos al mayoreo, todos colaboran en diversas actividades, este negocio inicio hace 20 aos pues fue una herencia familiar. Por el momento solicita un prstamo para invertirlo en gaseosas y jugos, pues las bebidas son parte importante dentro del negocio, dando a los clientes un buen servicio. Sus aspiraciones con el negocio es aumentar sus ventas, su clientela y las ganancias, para crecer en el comercio y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, formndose acadmicamente para mejorar sus oportunidades de superacin.
texts.en:
Tomas lives with his wife and two children who are 14 and 17 years of age. He runs a business that his wife and children also work in selling products at wholesale. Everyone helps out with the various activities. The business started 20 years ago because it was a family inheritance.
At present, hes asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and juices because beverages are an important part of the business to provide good customer service.
His business goals are to increase sales, the number of customers and profits to grow in the marketplace and help his children with their schooling so that they can attain academic development to improve their opportunities for self-improvement.

loan.use: to buy soft drinks and juices at wholesale.

loan.name: Livia Maria

texts.es: Livia es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 aos de edad, est casada y tiene 9 hijos, 8 de ellos independientes. Livia estudi hasta 3ro de educacin primaria. La seora se dedica desde hace mucho a la venta de comidas de forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace tres ciclos. Su primer prstamo fue por la suma de de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incremento al capital de su negocio. Con este nuevo prstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevo soles, la seora invertir en la compra de insumos como papa, chuo, carne, chicharrn y otros productos ms, trabaja sola en el negocio aunque a veces le ayuda su hija. Su esposo es militar. Su sueo es seguir con el negocio o poner una tienda bien surtida (bodega) y dejar este negocio debido a que es muy agotador. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del prstamo y el prstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Livia is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) communal bank located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. Shes 56 years old, married and has 9 children, 8 of them independent. Livia studied up to 3rd grade.
For some time now shes been a food vendor in the main square. Shes worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three cycles. Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she used to increase working capital.
She will use this new, 600 new sol, loan to buy ingredients like potatoes, dehydrated, freeze-dried potatoes, meat, pork skin and other products. She works alone although her daughter helps her sometimes. Her husbands in the military.
Her dream is to stay in this business or install a well-stocked grocery store and leave this business because it is quite exhausting.
What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan and the loan from the internal account.

loan.use: to buy ingredients like potatoes, dehydrated freeze-dried potato, meat, pork skin and others.

loan.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es: El comit San Miguel Arcangel est formado por 10 mujeres, que son amigas y vecinas, de la ciudad de Caacup. Las Sras., son mujeres muy trabajadoras, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia. La Sra. Digna vive con sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas desde hace ya unos, razn por la cual ya tiene la clientela formada. Ella disfruta de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto. Ella suea con algn da, poder abrir una joyera donde vender sus joyas, adems de eso comenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por sus hijos, por darles un futuro digno y una buena educacin. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de mas joyas, como ser anillos pulseras, cadenas y dems, para la posterior venta. Ella esta muy esperanzada en el crdito, ya que le ser de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Arcangel committee (St Michael Archangel) is made up of ten women who are friends and neighbours from the city of Caacup. They are very hardworking women with a great desire to get ahead in life and bring up their families.
Digna lives with her children and has worked selling jewellery for a number of years. Because of this, she already has a stable customer base. She enjoys what she does as it is worthy and honest work. Digna dreams of one day opening a jewellery store where she can sell her jewellery. She also tells us that everything she has sacrificed is for her children, to give them a decent future and a good education.
Digna is requesting a loan to purchase more jewellery such as rings, bracelets, chains and other items for resale. This loan has filled her with hope as it will be of great help to her.

loan.use: to purchase jewellery for resale such as rings, chains, bracelets and other items.

loan.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Olga, es una cliente nueva, que vino a la institucin por invitacin D. un cliente bueno, que trabaja actualmente en nuestra agencia. En el momento D. la evaluacin del crdito la Sra. demostr una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, La Sra. Olga vive en la zona tacagua la Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con sus dos hijos, el esposo por razones D. trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, saco este crdito para surtir su mercadera y adems para su capital, su puesto esta ubicado en una calle concurrida D. la ciudad, ella tiene su patente al da, venD. desD. horas 8,00 a 21,00, con el tiempo piensa mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa para el beneficio D. su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is a new client that came to the institution invited by a good client who currently works with our agency. When her evaluation took place she had a good, cordial and kind attituD..
Olga lives in La Paz, Bolivias Tacagua zone. She currently lives with her two children. Her husband, due to employment, is in the city of Santa Cruz.
She took out this loan to stock merchandise and also to use as working capital. Her stand is located on a busy city street. Her permit is up to date. She sells from 8am until 9pm.
In time she hopes to improve her houses infrastructure for her familys wellbeing.

loan.use: to buy merchandise.

loan.name: Mara Leidy

texts.es:
Generar ingresos propios despus de separarse de su esposo con el fin de cubrir sus necesidades bsicas y las de sus dos hijos impulsaron a Mara Leidy a crear su propio negocio, venta de mercanca especialmente de mquinas de afeitar para hombre, las cuales distribuye en diferentes municipios de Antioquia.
Para Mara Leidy este negocio es su nica fuente de empleo y aunque se siente bendecida por trabajar desde su casa, se ve enfrentada a dificultades que en ocasiones no le permite generar las ganancias necesarias pues algunos clientes no le pagan.
En el futuro, esta emprendedora espera convertirse en una gran distribuidora de todo tipo de mercanca para cacharreras; por ahora necesita de un prstamo para usarlo como capital de trabajo, pues a sus clientes les da plazo de 30 das para pagar y actualmente necesita comprar ms surtido para cumplir con los pedidos.
texts.en:
The need to earn her own income in order to meet her and her two children's basic needs after separating from her husband inspired Mara Leidy to create her own business. She sells razors for men, which she distributes throughout various municipalities in Antioquia.

Her business is Mara Leidy's only source of employment and even though she feels blessed to work from home, she faces difficulties in that there are occassions in which she doesn't earn enough income because some customers do not pay her.

In the future, this enterprising woman hopes to sell all types of pots and cookware, but now she needs a loan for working capital, as customers are given 30 days to pay and right now she needs to increase her supplies to meet demand.

loan.use: to buy men's razors

loan.name: Thelma Fabiola

texts.es: La seora Thelma fue integrante del banco de emprendimiento "buenas emprendedoras" que culminaron su ciclo sin ningn problema de mora ni atrasos. Se dedica a la venta de cosmticos por mayor y menor de diferentes casas de belleza, vive con su hija en la casa de sus papas. El crdito esta destinado a la compra de cosmticos por pedidos que ya los realizo y como maneja grupos de promotoras de ventas de cosmticos necesita comprar una computadora para el registro y envi de informacin a sus proveedores tanto de sus productos como de sus clientes todo esto lo maneja en el mismo domicilio donde vive la cliente, mas adelante piensa en ampliar su gama de ventas con otros productos de lnea blanca y electrodomsticos.
texts.en: Thelma was a founding member of the "Buenas Emprendedoras entrepreneurial bank, which completed a cycle without any problems, defaults, or falling behind in payments. She sells cosmetics in large and small quantity to different beauty shops and lives with her daughter at her parents house. She will use the money from this loan to fill cosmetic orders and, since she manages groups of salespersons, she needs to buy a computer to manage orders and send information about her products and customers to her suppliers. She works out of her home and, in the future, plans to expand her range of sales to include major and small appliances.

loan.use: to fill orders and buy a computer

loan.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Vctor, vive con su familia conformada por sus padres, su esposa, todos trabajan en su casa, se apoyan mutuamente para mantener el hogar, l por su parte vende medicinas, aprendi por la influencia de un amigo, trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido y tiene por ahora mucha experiencia. l est solicitando un prstamo para comprar medicinas para el negocio, esta inversin le permitir crecer y tener los productos necesarios para atender las necesidades de los clientes, comprara vitaminas, antibiticos, analgsicos, tanto en jarabe, pastillas e inyecciones. Su aspiracin es tener un crecimiento en el mercado, ser ms competente y tener ms oportunidades de superacin junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Vctor lives with his family, made up of his parents and wife. They all work at home and mutually support each-other to support the household. For his part he sells medications, having learned because of the influence of a friend. He sells on foot, does not have set hours, or much experience.
He is asking for this loan to buy medications for his business. This investment will allow his to grow his business and have the products on hand to fill his customers needs. He will buy vitamins, antibiotics, and analgesics in syrup, pill, and injection form.
His aspiration is to grow his market share, be more competitive, and have a better opportunity to get ahead with his family.

loan.use: to buy medications for resale

loan.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria tiene como actividad la venta de comida, actividad que realiza todos los das en su tienda que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados. La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que desarrolla conjuntamente con su hijas quienes le ayudan a preparar y atender a sus clientes, el destino del crdito es para la compra por mayor de insumos ( papa, arroz, fideo y otros ) para lograr tener una despensa llena, es un apersona muy trabajadora lleva aos en esta actividad de la venta de comida esta muy agradecida con la institucin por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Gloria sells food every day from her home-based store, where she prepares and offers various dishes to her customers. This is the primary source of income for her and her family and she does this together with her daughters, who help her to prepare the dishes and serve customers. She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients (potatoes, rice, noodles, and other items) to have a full stock on hand. She is a hard working lady who has been doing this for years and is grateful to the institution for the support she has gotten.

loan.use: to buy ingredients

loan.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan, vive con su esposa y su hermana, no tienen hijos y todos trabajan en la familia, l se dedica a la venta de sandia y a la agricultura, el negocio de sandia inicio por el apoyo de su hermana, no tiene un horario establecido para atender sus labores. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para la compra de insumos agrcolas y sandia para vender, est iniciando los cuidados de los cultivos por lo que necesita tener abono y fertilizantes, la compra le permitir contar con los recursos necesarios, adems de surtir el negocio de la sandia. Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente para comprarse su propia casa, dndole lo mejor a su familia y ofrecerles una mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and his sister. They do not have children and everyone in the family works. He works selling watermelons and in agriculture. The watermelon business started with the help of his sister and doesnt have a set work schedule.
He is currently requesting the loan to buy agricultural additives and watermelons to sell. He is beginning the care of the crops and thus needs to have manure and fertilizers. The purchase of these will give him to have the necessary resources, as well as to stock the watermelon business.
His goal is to work hard to buy his own home, giving the best to his family and offering them greater stability.

loan.use: to invest in manure and fertilizers and also in watermelons to sell.

loan.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Justine has had a small retail shop that sells sugar for 5 years.
To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family. In the future, Justine hopes to own a wholesale shop. She is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loan.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy an industrial serger (kind of sewing machine) and other supplies

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El seor Juan tiene como principal actividad econmica la elaboracin y venta de chocolates artesanales, los que comercializa en la ciudad de Cochabamba, el Sr. Juan comenz con esta actividad hace tres aos, con un pequeo capital, ahora este trabajo es el sustento principal de su familia, el vive en la zona de pasankeri con sus dos hijos y regresa solo a medio ao y a final de ao. Es cliente de la institucin desde el ao 2007 y siempre ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos, don Juan compra con el dinero del crdito el chocolate por kilo y los dems insumos por caja, elabora frutillas y mashmelos baados con chocolate y los vende a un precio econmico, trabaja toda la familia en distintos puntos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, as logran tener ms ingresos. El seor Juan en un corto plazo piensa en terminar de construir su domicilio para dar mayor comodidad a su familia cuando se encuentren en la ciudad de la paz.
texts.en:
Juan makes chocolate sculptures which he sells in Cochabamba. He started doing this three years ago with a little capital. Now this work provides the principal support for his family. He lives in the Pasankeri zone with his two children and returns only mid-year and at the end of the year. Hes been working with the institution since 2007 and has always proven to be punctual and responsible with his payments.
Juan buys chocolate by the kilo and the rest of his supply by the box. He makes chocolate covered fruit snacks and marshmallows and sells them for low prices. The whole family works in different parts of Cochabamba and in this way they can generate more income. Juan plans to finish building his house soon, so that his family will be more comfortable when they are in La Paz.

loan.use: to buy chocolate in bulk

loan.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosala tiene 53 aos de edad, est casada hace ms de 27 aos, tienen tres hijos todo mayores de edad. Esta seora es muy emprendedora, teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y su marido se encarga de venderlos a cuotas en la localidad de Villa Elisa en donde viaja cada mes a colocar y cobrar sus productos. Ella gracias a su trabajo y a la ayuda de su marido ha logrado mantener a sus hijos as como tambin afrontar todos los gastos de la casa. Est muy orgullosa de lo que hace, puesto que es un trabajo muy digno y sacrificado. Ella suea con que sus hijos sigan una carrera universitaria y se vuelva unos buenos profesionales. Solicita el prstamo para la compra de hilos y telas de color para tejer frazadas que en sta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosala is 53 years old and has been married for over 27 years. She has three children, all of whom are grown up. Rosalia is very enterprising and hand weaves blankets and shawls. Her husband is in charge of selling them in lots in the community of Villa Elisa, where he travels every month to deliver and collect payment for the goods.
Thanks to her work and the support of her husband, Rosalia has been able to raise her children and settle the home expenses. She is very proud of what she does as it is worthy and selfless work. Her dream is for her children to go to university and become good professionals.
Rosalia is applying for a loan to purchase colourful thread and fabric to weave blankets, since they are in high demand during this season.

loan.use: to purchase colourful thread and fabric

loan.name: Los Microempresarios Group

texts.es: Este Banco comunal se llama Los Microempresarios est conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquera, corte de lea y venta de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Diana quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en el segundo puesto de izquierda a derecha vistiendo una chaqueta color azul con aplicaciones en color celeste y pantalones de color morado estampados, se dedica al corte y confeccin de ropa. Comenta que le gusta innovar con sus productos, por lo tanto tambin compra ropa en la ciudad de Santiago y la vende directamente desde su domicilio. Sus clientes van a su casa para solicitar sus servicios de confeccin y adems aprovechan de comprar ropa que Diana compra en la ciudad de Santiago. Con el crdito comprar telas y ropa con novedosos diseos. Sus metas son establecerse en su negocio para abrir una boutique de ropa. Diana vive junto a su hija de 4 aos de edad, ella asiste al jardn infantil, por lo que Diana aprovecha ste tiempo para organizarse con su negocio, sin embargo su horario en general debe ser flexible debido a la compatibilidad en el horario de su hija. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se debe a que quiere obtener su casa propia y brindarle a su hija una mejor situacin socioeconmica. Para concretar su primer proyecto postular al subsidio habitacional, por lo que pretende que se concrete durante el mes de agosto. Diana se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del crdito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitir invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias en un futuro. Respecto a la relacin con los dems emprendedores, sta ha sido muy buena y se encuentran organizando diversas actividades grupales. Temuco es la capital de la regin de la Araucana. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilmetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucn, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta regin habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indgena, existente en nuestro pas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Microempresarios (the small entrepreneurs) is made up of 19 businesspeople who work in different areas such as: cosmetology, firewood, clothing sales, etc. All live in the city of Temuco. Diana, who is pictured second in the photo going from the left to right, is dressed in a blue jacket with sky blue decorations and purple patterned pants. She makes and sells clothing. She says that she likes to be innovative with her products so she also buys clothing in Santiago and sells them directly from her house. Her customers go there to place orders for the clothing that she makes and also to take advantage of the trip by purchasing what she buys in Santiago. She will use the loan to buy fabric and clothing with new designs. Her goal is to establish herself in her business so that she can open a clothing boutique.
Diana lives with her 4 year old daughter. She goes to a nursery school and Diana uses this time to organize her business. But her schedule is flexible in general since it works well with her daughters schedule.
The reason why she continues with her business is that she wants to have her own house and to offer her daughter a better standard of living. To firm up her first project she will use the housing benefit and thats what she hopes to do during the month of August. Diana is very happy and thankful for the financing offered her by Fondo Esperanza since it lets her invest in her business and generate higher earnings in the future. She gets along well with the other members of the bank and she organizes various group functions.
Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region and is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). There are a series of bathing spas (Pucn, Villarrica) around the city and beautiful flora and fauna concentrated in the nearby natural parks. It is notable that 50% of the Mapuches, a native people of Chile, live in the area.

loan.use: To buy fabric and clothing with new designs.

loan.name: Las Palomas De Agua Dulce Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Palomas de Agua Dulce, est conformado por la seora Graciela que va a comprar con su prstamo ropa para dama (pantalones, blusas, faldas) y para caballero (pantalones y camisas), la seora Flavia Paula va a comprar paquetes de colonias para dama y caballero y paquetes de Topperware para el hogar, la seora Virginia va a comprar artculos de regalo (bolsa, juguetes, pelotas, portarretratos y ramos para graduacin), l seor Lzaro va a comprar semilla de maz por bulto para sembrar y abono qumico por bulto, la seora Marisol, va a comprar carnes, verduras, cebolla y cilantro. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacin Realidad gracias por ayudarnos con sus prestamos y que sigan apoyando a ms personas para que sus negocios sigan creciendo y las familias esten mas unidas.
La seora Marisol tiene 25 aos de edad vive en unin libre con su esposo, ellos tiene 3 hijos Levit de 6 aos de edad est estudiando el 2. Ao de primaria, Alexandra de 3 aos de edad y Oscar de 9 meses de edad, ella vende taquitos de suadero y carne enchilada en la casa de su mama los dias sabados y domingos, ella solicito su prstamo para comprar carnes, verduras, nopales y bolsas para surtir su negocio, ella inicio su negocio hace un ao, este negocio era de su mama pero se lo heredo. Ella le ayudaba a su mama a preparar los taquitos y a atender a los clientes asi aprendio a preparar los taquitos, su esposo le dio dinero para comprar los insumos e iniciar con el negocio de venta de taquitos los sabados y domingos; ella est contenta con este prstamo que recibir de FRAC porque va a comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar los taquitos y tener a sus clientes mas contentos, su negocio es importante porque le ayuda a mejorar econmicamente, a ella le gusta cuando que la gente est satisfecha con el trato y la atencin que les proporciona, ella se siente orgullosa cuando le dicen que sus taquitos estn sabrosos y regresan los clientes a consumir los taquitos, ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a invertir en los insumos y poco a poco se va ampliando el negocio, para lo que necesite su hijo en la escuela y para algo que falte en la casa.
Ella tiene la esperanza de construir su casa en un terreno que tiene en Jaloxtoc y que su negocio siga creciendo para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Palomas de Agua Dulce (Sweetwater Doves). It consists of Graciela, who with the loan will buy womens clothing, pants, blouses, skirts, and for men, pants and shirts. Flavia Paula will buy packages of cologne for men and women, and Tupperware packages for the home. Virginia will buy gift items, bags, toys, balls, frames, and graduation bouquets. Lzaro will buy seed corn in bulk to sow, and chemical fertilizer in bulk. Marisol will buy meat, produce, onion, and cilantro. The groups members would like to say to Kiva and the Reality Foundation thanks for helping us with loans, and may you continue to support more people, so that their businesses continue to grow, and their families will stay together.
Marisol is 25 years old, and lives with her common-law spouse. They have 3 children, Levit, 6 years old, who is the second grade; Alexandra, 3 years old; and Oscar, 9 months old. She sells suadero tacos (brisket), and chili tacos from her mothers home on Saturdays and Sundays. She requests a loan in order to buy meat, produce, nopal (cactus), and bags to stock her business. She started her business a year ago. It was her mothers business, but she inherited it. She used to help her mother prepare the tacos and serve customers, and thus learned to prepare tacos. Her spouse gave her money to buy supplies and start up the business selling tacos on Saturdays and Sundays. She is happy with the loan she got, because she will buy supplies needed to prepare tacos and keep her customers happy. Her business matters, because it helps her financially. She is happy when people are satisfied with the service provided. She feels proud when they tell her that her tacos are tasty, and they come back for more tacos. She uses the earnings to invest in supplies, and gradually is expanding her business, for things that her son needs in school, and things needed at home.
She hopes to build a house on a piece of land she has in Jaloxtoc, and for her business to continue to grow, in order to provide a better life for her children, and for them to have what they need.

loan.use: buy meat, produce, nopal (type of cactus), and bags.

loan.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
La falta de oportunidades para conseguir empleo despus de quedar desempleada y la necesidad de generar ingresos propios, hicieron que Olga emprendiera su propio negocio. Una mesa, un cuchillo y algunos implementos bsicos para iniciar con la venta de frutas fueron los implementos con los que esta emprendedora le dio vida a su negocio.
Como ella misma lo explica no fue fcil debido a que Espacio Pblico, entidad que regula los negocios ambulantes en Medelln, le concedi despus de mucho tiempo el permiso para trabajar en las calles del centro de la ciudad, desde entonces est un poco ms estable y ha ido consiguiendo sus propios clientes, personas que frecuentemente transitan por la calle donde ella tiene su venta de frutas.
Actualmente, Olga necesita de un prstamo para comprar mayor variedad de frutas, comprar una carpa unas llantas para adecuar su punto de venta.
texts.en:
A lack of opportunities for getting a job after she became unemployed and the need to make her own income led Olga to set up her own business. She had a table, a knife and some basic tools with which to start her fruit selling business selling fruit. It was with these tools that this entrepreneur gave life to her business.
As she herself explains, it wasn't easy because 'Espacio Pblico' (Public Space) - the entity that regulates itinerant businesses in Medelln - took a long time to grant her a permit which would allow her to work in the streets in the city center. However, since she received the permit, things have been a little more stable and she has been gaining customers: people who frequently pass through the street where she has her fruit business.
Olga currently needs a loan to buy a wider variety of fruit. She will also buy an awning and tires for her sales outlet.

loan.use: to buy a wider variety of fruit, and to buy an awning and some tires for her sales outlet

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase chicken, cracklings, soft cheese, bread, and soft drinks for the business.

loan.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 aos D. edad, est casada y tiene 5 hijos, 4 D. ellos independientes y uno an estudiando. Luisa no cuenta con estudios. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace seis aos, su primer prstamo fue por la suma D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirti en su negocio D. venta D. comida. Con este nuevo prstamo D. S/ 2,000.00 nuevo soles, comprar papa, chuo, una caja D. aceite, un paquete D. sal, carne, trucha, queso, etc., la seora nos cuenta que sus ventas las realiza todos los das en la Panamericana y su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, l es agricultor. Su sueo es tener una tienda D. abarrotes, cuenta que est cansada D. trabajar en este negocio, le duele la columna, por eso quiere cambiar D. negocio, ver uno ms tranquilo y que no le demanD. cargar peso. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distraccin para las socias, la facilidad del prstamo y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the "Medalla Milagrosa" ["Miraculous Medal"] Communal Bank, located in the district of Pomata, province of Chucuito, and department of Puno. She is 53 years old, married, and has five children; four of them are independent and one is still in school. Luisa does not have any education.
She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years now. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her food sales business.
With this new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy potatoes, potato flour, a box of oil, a packet of salt, meat, trout, cheese, etc. She tells Movimiento Manuela Ramos that she makes her sales every day along the Panamerican Highway, and that he husband - a farmer - helps her with the business.
Her dream is to have a grocery story. She explains that she is tired of working in this business. Her back hurts and she would therefore like to change her business to something more tranquil and that doesn't require lifting heavy loads.
She enjoys meetings with her communal bank because it is a distraction for all of the members, for the ease of the loan process, and for the ability to save money.

loan.use: to buy potatoes, potato flour, a box of oil, a packet of salt, meat, trout, cheese, etc.

loan.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema forma parte del banco comunal Mi Esfuerzo perteneciente a la comuna de La Cisterna, ciudad de Santiago. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 16 aos, durante ste tiempo ha vendido diversos productos. En la actualidad se encuentra vendiendo ropa de nios, juguetes y ropa para el invierno entre guantes, gorros y bufandas. Estos productos los vende afuera de un hospital, trabajando en esto de lunes a viernes. Adems durante las tardes aprovecha de vender parafina, combustible para encender estufas durante la temporada de invierno, los clientes compran directamente en su domicilio. En la temporada de verano se dedica a preparar diversos alimentos como humitas y ensaladas preparadas. Comenta que durante todo el ao le va bien en sus diferentes negocios, ya que aprovecha al mximo cada temporada. Su mercadera la compra en dos distribuidoras de ropa ubicadas en el centro de la ciudad de Santiago. Con el crdito comprar un tarro de parafina y un fardo de ropa, que adems viene con un fardo de disfraces. Zulema cuenta con un vehculo particular para trasladar su mercadera, lo que le facilita su trabajo. Ella vive junto a un hermano, su marido y sus cinco hijos de 18, 13, gemelos de 12 y uno de 10 aos de edad. Sus motivaciones de continuar en el rubro se deben a que desea costear los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido, que cuente con los servicios de internet, fotocopiadora, cargas de celular y tarjeta bip (forma de pago del transporte en la ciudad de Santiago), adems de vender productos de bazar, espera concretar ste proyecto en un plazo de dos aos. Zulema est muy contenta y agradecida de los crditos obtenidos por Fondo esperanza, ya que le han permitido invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Respecto a las reuniones y capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones del grupo del Banco comunal, le han parecido muy bien ya que ha aprendido a administrar su negocio. El grupo del banco comunal es muy unido y comprometido con cada uno de sus negocios. La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la regin Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su poblacin y la llegada de servicios pas a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Zulema is one of the members of the Mi Esfuerzo communal bank, which is part of the La Cistema community of Santiago. She has been working as a merchant for 16 years, during which she has sold various types of products. She sells childrens clothing, toys, and winter clothing including gloves, and scarves. She sells these items outside a hospital, Monday through Friday. She also takes advantage and sells paraffin, used to fuel heaters during the winter, in the evenings. Her customers buy from her in her home. During the summer she prepares various types of food such as humitas and prepared salads. She says that things go well for all of her businesses during the year because she takes maximum advantage of each season.
She buys her merchandise from clothing distributors in Santiago. She will use the money from this loan to buy a container of paraffin and a pack of clothing that also comes with a pack of costumes. Zulema has a vehicle of her own that she uses to move her merchandise, making her work easier. She lives with her brother, her husband, and five children, ages 18, 13, 12 (twins) and 10. She is motivated to continue her work because she wants to provide university educations for her children. Her business goals are to have a local establishment that will also provide Internet, copy, and cell phone charging services, also bip cards (used to pay for public transportation around Santiago). She also wants to sell paper goods. She expects to set this up within two years.
Zulema is very happy and grateful for the loans she has gotten through Fondo Esperanza because they have made it possible for her to invest in her business and increase her income. She also thinks that the training she has gotten during her communal bank meetings has been good and has taught her how to better manage her business. The members of the communal bank are very united and dedicated to their businesses.
La Cisterna is a Community located in the central metropolitan area. Its essentially a residential and commercial area. It used to be a rural area; however it became an urban area because of the growth of its population and the availability of services.

loan.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loan.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: Mara es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 49 aos de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo. Mara estudi la secundaria. Se dedica a la venta de comidas, tambin vende bebidas gaseosas, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis aos. Su prstamo inicial fue por la suma de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirti en su negocio. Con ste nuevo prstamo de S/ 1,200.00 nuevo soles, comprar treinta cajas de gaseosas de todo tamao y sabores. Nos cuenta que la venta de comida la realiza los das sbado y martes. Ella trabaja sola en el negocio. Su sueo es seguir y mejorar el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos. Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Medalla Milagrosa" village bank, located in the district of Pomata, province of Chucito, department of Puno. She is 49, single and has 1 child. Maria studied through high school.
She sells food as well as sodas. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her initial loan was for a sum of 300 nuevos soles, money that she invested in her business.
With this new loan of 1200 nuevos soles she will buy 30 boxes of sodas of all sizes and flavors. She tells us that she sells food on Saturdays and Tuesdays. She works alone in her business.
Her dream is to continue with her business and improve it so that she can increase her income. What she likes most about her village bank are the reunions, the punctuality and the responsibility.

loan.use: to buy 30 boxes of sodas of all sizes and flavors.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs and supplies in greater volume and quantity.

loan.name: Rosa Marili

texts.es: Rosa, es una persona de familia, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a atender una sala de belleza, tiene ao y medio de estar en el negocio, inicio siendo empleada de un saln, luego decidi instalar su propio servicio de belleza a los clientes de la zona. Actualmente est solicitando un prstamo ya que desea mejorar el inventario de productos de belleza, comprando tintes para el cabello, tratamientos faciales, maquillajes, con esta inversin pretende mejorar el servicio para los clientes. Espera que despus de la inversin atender un mayor nmero de clientes, satisfaciendo sus necesidades, su aspiracin es ampliar los servicios, capacitarse ms, ambicionando un desarrollo econmico para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is family-oriented. She lives with her two children and her husband. She has a beauty salon that has been open for a year and a half. She began as an employee at a salon and later decided to start her own salon for the customers in the area.
Currently she is asking for a loan because she wants to improve her inventory of beauty products, buying hair dyes, facial treatments and makeup. With this investment she will be able to improve the service that she provides her customer.
She hopes that after the investment she will have more customers and meet their needs. Her dream is to increase her services and get more training, with the goal of economic development for her family.

loan.use: to buy hair dyes, facial treatments and makeup for the beauty salon.

loan.name: Alipio

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Papel Pata distrito de Echarate (La Convencin, Cusco, Per) conocimos al seor Alipio y nos cuenta que l naci en la ciudad de Echarate y que tiene 48 aos de edad, l est casado y fruto de esta relacin tiene seis hijios. Actualmente, Alipio vive en la comunidad de Pispita y est ubicado a unos 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba y donde desarrolla sus actividades econmicas.
Alipio se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de cacao, caf, y frutas en especial ctricos como por ejemplo naranjas, madarinas, lima y otros.
Solicita el crdito para comprar una motosierra pues necesita para cortar rboles y hacer lea. Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafos como las plagas. Su sueo es dedicarse por completo la pesquera.
texts.en:
In the community of Papel Pata, district of Echarate (La Convencin, cusco, Per) we met Mr. Alipio who told us that he was born in the city of Echarate and is 48 years old. He is married and has six children. He currently lives in the community of Pispita which is approximately 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba where he has his business.
Alipio is a farmer and grows cocoa, coffee and citrus fruits such as oranges, tangerines, limes and others.
He is requesting a loan to buy a buzzsaw which he needs to cut down trees for firewood. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs. He is up against challenges such as plagues. His dream is to one day be in the fishing business.

loan.use: To buy a buzzsaw.

loan.name: Marizol Valeria

texts.es: Marizol es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 40 aos de edad, est casada y tiene 3 hijos an estudiando. Tiene educacin secundaria. Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de comidas, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete aos, su primer prstamo fue por la suma de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirti en su negocio de venta de comidas, tambin se dedica a la crianza de truchas y vende pan. Ahora solicitar un nuevo prstamo por la suma de S/ 2500.00 nuevo soles, prstamo que invertir en la compra de veinte sacos de alimentos para las truchas, cada saco cuesta S/. 150.00 nuevo soles, para completar esta compra ella cuenta con un pequeo capital. Cuenta que los das viernes, sbado y domingo vende comida, dos veces a la semana vende pan en Ilave y la trucha lo vende cada ocho meses en Desaguadero, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien es albail. Ella es toda una comerciante. Su sueo es salir adelante en el negocio y tener otros negocios ms que le permita generar otros ingresos. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las bromas de las socias. No hay caso de retirarse porque dice que se acostumbr a ese ritmo.
texts.en:
Marizol is a member of the communal bank "Medalla Milagrosa", located in the district of Pomata, province of chucuito, department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She received a high school education.
Together with her husband she sells food. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years. The first loan she had, in the amount of 300 PEN, was used in her food business. She also raises trout and sells bread. The new loan she is requesting, for 2,500 PEN, will be used to buy sacks of feed for the trout. Each sack costs 150 PEN. On Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays she sells food, and two times a week she sells bread. Her trout is sold every eight months in Desaguadero. Helping out in her business are her children and husband, who is a bricklayer. Marizol is every bit a saleslady.
Her dream is to grow her business and start up new ones that will increase her income. What she likes best about the communal bank is the joke-telling among the members. She is not planning to retire soon because she is accustomed to her work pace.

loan.use: To buy sacks of feed for her trout.

loan.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Motivada por generar ingresos adicionales para contribuir a los gastos de su hogar, desde hace algunos aos, Ana Celia decidi crear su propio negocio, una miscelanea en la que ofrece diversidad de productos. Esta emprendedora valora el hecho de trabajar cerca de su casa y dedicarle tiempo a sus dos hijos, aunque reconoce que no ha sido fcil por los momentos de violencia por los que ha a travesado el barrio donde est ubicado el negocio en Medelln, sabe que la dedicacin es lo que le ha permitido seguir adelante.
En el futuro, Ana Celia espera ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Actualmente necesita de un prstamo para comprar algunos productos y as ampliar su oferta.
texts.en:
Motivated to make additional income to contribute to her household expenses some years ago, Ana Celia decided to set up her own business, a general store in which she sells a range of different products. This entrepreneur values the fact that she works not far from her home and is able to devote time to her two children although she recognizes that it has not been easy because of the violent times that the Medelln neighborhood in which her business is located has experienced. She knows that her commitment is what has enabled her to get ahead.
In the future, Ana Celia hopes to expand her business in order to improve her income and offer a better quality of life to her family. She currently needs a loan to buy some products and thereby expand her offerings.

loan.use: to buy products such as stationery, clothes and personal care products

loan.name: Gioconda

texts.es: Doa Gioconda tiene su propio negocio, dedicada a la venta de tortillas y la venta de ropa, lo que logro a hace cuatro aos, con el apoyo de su esposo, luego para invertir ms, logra el financiamiento en Afodenic, en donde sus ventas aumentaron al producir ms venta de tortilla. Su venta de ropa la ofrece a sus misma clienta de tortilla, vendiendo al contado y al crdito. Sus cuatro hijos son casados, solo una nia de 5 aos est a su cuidado. Con este nuevo prstamo comprara: maseca, maz, pantalones y camisas, faldas, para obtener mejores ingresos, y poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos bsicos, gastos personales, y sus compromisos de pago. Como planes es poder ampliar el local de su venta, que espera con el apoyo financiero de Afodenic lograrlo.
texts.en:
Gioconda owns her own business selling tortillas and clothes. She managed to set her business up four years ago with the support of her husband. Then, in order to invest some more, she took a loan from Afodenic. Her sales increased as she was able to produce more tortillas to sell.
Gioconda sells clothes to the same customers who buy her tortillas. She makes her sales for cash and on credit. Her four children are married and she now only has a 5 year-old girl in her care.
With this new loan, Gioconda will buy 'Maseca' (corn meal), corn, pants, shirts and skirts, in order to make better income and be able to support her husband with their basic expenses, personal expenses and repayment obligations. Gioconda's plan is to expand her sales location. She hopes to achieve this with the financial support of Afodenic.

loan.use: to buy corn meal, corn, and men and women's clothes

loan.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, vive con su esposa, aun no tiene hijos, los dos trabajan, l es empleado de la alcalda municipal desde hace 22 aos, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00am a 4:00pm. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para la compra de mercadera pues tiene un negocio el cual lo administra su esposa, ofrece productos de primera necesidad e invertir el prstamo en productos como: aceite, frijoles, arroz, huevos, pan y boquitas, esta inversin le ayudara a abastecer el inventario y mantener todo lo necesario para los hogares. Su aspiracin es ampliar el negocio y mejorar la econmica de su hogar, as como tambin laborar cada da de una manera excelente para perdurar en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife. They do not have any children and they both work. Miguel has been working for the council for 22 years. He works from 8.00am to 4.00pm.
Miguel is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise as he owns a business which his wife runs. They sell basic household products. He will invest the loan in products such as oil, beans, rice, eggs, bread and snacks. This investment will help him to stock the business and have available everything that households need.
Miguel's aspiration is to expand the business and improve his household's financial situation, as well as to work hard every day in order to remain in his job.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for his business (oil, beans, rice, eggs, bread and snacks)

loan.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
La A.C. CORAZON DE JESUS iniciar su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, est compuesta por nueve integrantes y est dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la seora Rosario. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociacin comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de humintas, venta de electro domsticos, respoteria, comerciante de verduras, quemador de CDs y DVDs, peinadora y peluquera, venta de ropa, y tienda.
La seora Rosario, indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer y que integro la institucin por invitacin. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el que aprendi de su amiga
El crdito que ahora sacar es para la compra aumentar su capital (compra de fideos, azcar, arroz, etc.) que comprar por mayor de la calle Garita de Lima y que posteriormente lo vender en esa misma calle. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qu le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitacin en crdito y salud.
texts.en:
The CORAZON DE JESUS community bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors headed by Rosario. The businesses that the association's members have are varied. Among them, we have: selling humitas, selling appliances, pastries, selling vegetables, burning CD's and DVD's, hairstyling and hair cutting, selling clothes, and a store.
Rosario indicates that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and she joined via invitation. At present, she has a small store, which she learned about from a friend.
The loan that she is taking out now is to make purchases and increase her capital. She will buy pasta, sugar, rice, etc. She will make her purchases wholesale on Garita de Lima street and later she will sell them on the same street. This work will allow her to generate income to support her family. She is single and has two children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit and health trainings.

loan.use: to buy pasta, rice, sugar, etc.

loan.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Victor is married. He is the father of five children: three sons and two daughters. Victor is an entrepreneur from Kamenka. He restores old furniture and also manufactures and sells custom-made furniture such as armchairs and sofas, in his town and region. He has his own Website on the Internet, with photos of his wares: http://foto.mail.ru/mail/viktor-kamenka/31?page=1
11 years ago, Victor saw a video in which a man was telling about this type of business and decided to try it for himself. Victor is well known in his home town for the excellent quality of his work. He has been in this business for 11 years. Victors wife is a seamstress. She actively helps him in all his business initiatives, as does their elder son. Victor has invested around 20,000 UAH in his stock. His revenues are about 10,000 UAH. Victor plans to use Kivas loan of 10,000 in order to buy materials for making armchairs and sofa, such as foam, fabric, wood, as well as materials and tools to prepare tents. The Kiva loan will allow him to stock up on supplies and therefore finish his orders more quickly. Victor has also started manufacturing tents for automobiles and trailers, for use in storage facilities etc, and needs special tools and materials for this type of work.
Note: profile description is provided in Russian.

loan.use: to buy supplies for making furniture as well as supplies and tools for making tents

loan.name: Alicia Margarita

texts.es: Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 58 aos de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo. Estudi hasta la secundaria. Desde hace nueve aos trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer prstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirti en la compra de un par de animales (chanchos), tambin se dedica a la venta de comida, ropa, bebidas gaseosas y venta de ganados, es decir, productos en general. Con ste nuevo prstamo de S/ 2500.00 nuevo soles, comprar ganados y mercaderas como gaseosas, calzados, chamarras. La seora nos cuenta que a veces vende ropa de segunda mano. En el negocio le ayuda su hijo. Su sueo es tener una pequea casa y tienda de bazar en Puno o Pomata. Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas porque dice que las mujeres son buenas para superarse en el negocio, tambin le gusta la garanta de las socias y la colaboracin que se brinda entre ellas.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) communal bank located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province in Puno Department. Shes 58 years old and the single mother of one son. She studied up to secondary school.
Shes worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last nine years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to buy a pair of pigs. She also sells food, clothes, and soft drinks and sells livestock, that is to say, products in general.
She will use this new, 2500 new sol, loan to buy livestock and assorted merchandise like soft drinks, footwear and jackets. She tells us that sometimes she sells second hand clothing. Her son helps her in the business. Her dream is to have a little house and general store in Puno or Pomata.
What she likes about the communal bank is the chats because she says the women are good at improving in business and she also likes the guarantee and mutual collaboration the members provide for each other.

loan.use: to buy livestock and merchandise like soft drinks, footwear and jackets.

loan.name: Francia

texts.es: Francia es una mujer de 33 aos, que vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolvar, con su esposo y su hijo de 13 aos el cual se encuentra estudiando. Francia tiene el negocio de elaborar artesanas desde hace tres aos, anteriormente venda solo por encargo, pero como se capacit con el SENA para perfeccionar el oficio artesanal, tiene contacto con varios clientes y una ta que le presta mercancas y la ha asesorado para emprender su propio almacn donde ella vive y con esto est muy entusiasmada. Porque su sueo es crecer hasta lograr un punto comercial bien posicionado donde su esposo tambin pueda trabajar con ella. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprar insumos, dos vitrinas para aprovechar el sitio y otras manualidades que ella no produce , ofreciendo as mayor diversidad.. Esta inversin tendr xito debido a que es una zona comercial de fcil acceso y con parqueadero, donde llegan muchos visitantes que son impactados por la belleza de sus productos. Mientras Francia cumple con su sueo, continua manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 21%, una razn corriente de 24.
texts.en:
Francia is a 33 year-old woman who lives in the town of San Jacinto, in Bolvar department, with her husband and her 13 year-old son who is in school. Francia's business is making handicrafts. She has been doing this for three years. She previously used to sell her products to order only but she trained with SENA (a national apprenticeship service) in order to perfect her trade and made connections with a number of customers and a lady who provides her with merchandise and who advised her to set up her own store in her area. Francia is very excited about all this as her dream is to grow her business until she has a well-positioned sales location where her husband can work with her.
This Kiva loan is Francia's first loan through Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy supplies, two display cabinets to make the most of her location, and other handicrafts that she doesn't make herself, so that she can offer a wider range of products. This investment will be successful because her business is located in an easily accessible commercial area with a parking lot. Many people come to her business and they are impressed with the beauty of her products. While Francia realizes her dream, she continues maintaining a sales profitability of no less than 21% and a current ratio of 24.

loan.use: to buy supplies, two display cabinets and other handicrafts

loan.name: Svitlana

texts.en: Svitlana is married and the mother of two sons, eight and three years old. She is an entrepreneur living in Ivano-Frankivsk. She works as a vendor at the main industrial market Traian. After finishing technical college, Svitlana decided against accepting a low-paying job and started working as a marketplace vendor instead. After having worked for three years as an employee, she decided to launch her own business, which she is still running at present. She sells various accessories such as belts, handbags, caps, blazers, slippers etc. Her stall is well known with customers thanks to her low prices on a wide variety of goods. Svitlana has been doing this line of work for eight years. Her monthly income is 5,000 Hryvnias (UAH). She is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH. She plans to stock up on belts (250 pcs) and handbags (15 pcs) for retail. She would like to get ready for August and replenish her selection of goods oriented toward young people. Svitlanas business is the main source of income for her family. She does not get discouraged, even though she had to give up one of her stalls due to financial crisis. At least she has managed to preserve her business, and now she continues to grow it further. Svitlana would like to use her anticipated earnings to pay for repairs in the apartment where her whole family lives. Note: this loan description is provided in Russian.

loan.use: to buy 250 belts and 15 handbags for retailing

loan.name: La Carrera Group

texts.es: El grupo de la Carrera se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Dotegiare, San Felipe del progreso, es una comunidad totalmente de origen Mazahua,la comunidad es grande y esta en las faldas de un monte, para llegar al lugar hay que caminar mucho, aunque si hay una carretera en buen estado no pasa el servicio de taxi o de camion, la gente platica que es muy normal para ellos caminar mucho para salir o entrar a su comunidad, ya se acostumbraron y tampoco se les hace retirado el camino, la actividad economica de la comunidad es la agricultura comercio ya que crian animales como borregos, puercos, pollos y guajolotes para poderlos vender, es manera de poder tener ingresos extras mas que nada de las seoras ya que los hombres salen a trabajar y muchos de ellos se van a la ciudad de Mxico en busca de un trabajo, En el grupo de la carrera se encuentra la representante y ella nos platica sobre su negocio, la seora se llama Victoria y su negocio es vender verduras, vende calabaza, zanahorias, flor de calabaza, nopales, chayotes, cilantro, cebolla etc; la seora tiene poco mas de 4 aos que se animo a vender verdura en su comunidad, no tiene un lugar estable en el que pueda estar vendiendo, lo que hace es andar caminando casa por casa para ofrecer su mercancia, y se le dificulta mucho la caminada y andar cargando la verdura, tambien que le calcula en el peso para poder dar los kilos, pero muchas veces la gente siempre le pide mas porque dice que le falta para completar el kilo, son estas las cosas que en ocasiones desaniman a la seora de seguir con el negocio, la seora Victoria piensa invertir el crdito en comprar mas verdura para salir a vender y tener un poco mas de ganancias y tambien utilizar las cosas que no se vendan para que ella pueda hacer su comida en casa, le gustaria mucho a la seora tener un local propio para vender varias cosas y hacer una tienda grande dejar de caminar y estar en su casa con su negocio, doa Victoria tiene 3 hijos que van a la escuela, tiene 37 aos y 14 aos de casada, vive con su familia en casa propia y su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Mxico.El resto de los integrantes se llaman; 1.-Maria Angela, ella cria y venta de borregos y pollos 2.-Maria Bonifacia hace bordados y servilletas 3.-Fidelina tiene una tienda de abarrotes 4.-Alejandra hace servilletas, cose y tambien sabe bordar 5.-Julia, cria y vende borregos 6.-Ernestina, cria pollos y guajolotes 7.-Noe, cria borregos para vender 8.-Maria sabe bordar y vende manteles 9.-Abel tiene una tienda en su comunidad de abarrotes Son 10 integrantes del grupo de la carrera y se nombraron as por una comunidad que esta muy cerca de la de ellos y les gusta mucho ese nombre, es la razn por la que desidieron ponerle este nombre a su grupo
texts.en:
The La Carrera group is located in the community of Dotegiare, San Felipe del Progreso, a community thats totally Mazahua. The community is large and located on the skirts of a mountain. To get to it one must travel quite a bit. Although there is a highway in good condition there is no taxi or bus service. People relate that its quite normal for them to walk quite a bit to get into or to leave their community. However, they are now used to this and the road doesnt even seem very long to them anymore.
The communitys economic activity is farming or commerce since they raise such animals as lambs, pigs, chickens and turkeys to sell. This is a way of earning extra income more for the women than the men because the men to out to work and many of them go to Mxico City to look for work.
The La Carrera group has a representative, Victoria, who tells us about her business. Her business is selling vegetables. She sells squash, carrots, squash blossoms, cactus paddles, chayote, cilantro, onions, etc. Its been a little more than four years now that she ventured to sell vegetables in her community. She does not have a fixed location to sell so she does it going house to house to offer her merchandise. Its quite difficult for her to walk so much carrying her vegetables. She also has to calculate the weight to sell by the kilo and often people insist on more because they claim the kilo is short. These are the things that sometimes discourage her to continue with the business.
Victoria plans to use the loan to buy more vegetables to go out to sell and have a bit more profits and she uses the items she doesnt sell to prepare her meals at home. Shed very much like to have a locale of her own to sell several things and to have a large store in order to not have to be wandering about anymore and be able to stay at home with her business.
Victoria has three children going to school. Shes 37 years old and has been married 14 years. She lives wither family in her own house and her husband works in Mxico City.
The rest of the group members are:
1.-Mara ngela, she raises sheep and chickens to sell 2.-Mara Bonifacia, she makes napkins and embroiders 3.-Fidelina, she has a grocery store 4.-Alejandra, makes napkins, sews and also knows how to embroider 5.-Julia, raises and sells sheep 6.-Ernestina, raises chickens and turkeys 7.-Noe, raises sheep to sell 8.-Mara, knows how to embroider and sells tablecloths 9.-Abel, has a grocery store in his community
There are 10 members in the La Carrera group and they named it that way after a community thats very near them and they like the name very much; thats why they decided to name their group that.

loan.use: to sell fruit and vegetables.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loan.name: Edelmira Fresaida

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Papel Pata del distrito de Echarate (La Convencin, Cusco, Per) conocimos a la seora Edelmira y nos cuenta que ella naci en la ciudad de Echarate y tiene 46 aos de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas (Yennifer de 23 aos, Cynthia de 21 aos). Actualmente, Edelmira vive en la comunidad de Chogona a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba y donde desarrolla sus actividades econmicas.
Edelmira trabaja en la municipalidad de Quillabamba en el rea de almacn y adems se dedica al cultivo de frutas ctricas, caf, cacao, yuca, maz y frejol y todo vende en la ciudad de Quillabamba.
Solicita el crdito para la pagar los gastos de la universidad de su hija sea para el hospedaje ya que ella estudia en la Universidad Nacional de la ciudad del Cusco. Su sueo de Edelmira es constituir una empresa de elaboracin de vestidos de alta calidad.
texts.en:
Edelmira lives in the Papel Pata community in the Echarate district (La Convencin, Cusco, Peru) an tells us that she was born in the city of Echarate and is 46-years-old. She is a a single mother and has two daughters (Yennifer who is 23-years-old and Cynthia who is 21-years-old). Edelmira currently lives in the community of Chogona, 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba and where she develops her economic activities.
Edelmira works for the municipality of Quillabamba in their storage facilities and also works growing citrus fruits, coffee, cacao, yucca, corn, and beans which she sells in Quillabamba.
She is requesting the loan to pay the university expenses of her daughter. Those expenses are her housing expenses as she studies in the National University of Cusco. Edelmiras dream is to build a business making high quality dresses.

loan.use: to pay university expenses for her daughter.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy seeds to plant bananas

loan.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: El Comit Mujeres Trabajadoras es la ciudad de Luque, se inici gracias a la iniciativa de 4 seoras, quienes ya haban formado parte de otro comit, ellas comentaron a sus vecinas y amigas sobre el proyecto y ellas encantadas formaron parte del comit. Actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del Programa y esta conformado por 20 seoras que invierten en distintas actividades. La seora Juliana, ella esta casada, con el seor Leoncio quien es pintor de obras, juntos tienen tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, tiene ya una cantidad de clientes bien definidos, que cada lapso de tiempo van a comprar de ella sus ropas. Ella esta muy contenta con su trabajo ya que por medio de este ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a su marido con la casa. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de ropas de temporada, lo cual le servir para abastecer su negocio y as poder cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Trabajadoras' committee is based in the city of Luque. It was formed thanks to the initiative of four ladies who had been members of another committee. They talked to their neighbors and friends about the project. They were very keen to join and so they formed a committee. The group is currently in its second cycle of the program and is made up of 20 ladies who invest in different business activities.
Juliana is married to Leoncio who is a painter and decorator. The couple have three children. Juliana sells clothes. She already has a number of well-defined customers who come to buy clothes from her every so often. She is very happy with her work since it has enabled her to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses.
Juliana is requesting this loan to buy seasonal clothes. This will allow her to stock her business and meet her customer demand.

loan.use: to buy seasonal clothes to sell

loan.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angelica es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 72 aos D. edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos independientes. Estudi hasta 5to D. primaria. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace nueve aos, el prstamo anterior D. S/ 200.00 nuevo soles lo invirti en su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta D. chanchos, mantones y colchas. Con ste nuevo prstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprar seis chanchos, cuenta que a veces los compra regulares y pequeos para su engorD. por tres meses. Tambin trabaja a crdito. Su sueo es seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del prstamo, el compaerismo y la ganancia D. sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the communal bank "Medalla Milagrosa," located in the Pomata district of Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is a 72 year-old widow who has 2 grown children. She has a 5th graD. education.
Angelica has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 9 years. Her previous loan was for 200 Peruvian soles, and she invested that money in her grocery store business. Now she has a business buying and selling pigs, shawls and bedspreads.
With this new loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles she will buy 6 pigs. She says that at times she buys regular and small sized pigs to fatten for 3 months. She also works on credit.
Her dream is to continue with her business and improve her income.
What she likes most about her communal bank are the easy terms on the loans, the camaraderie amongst the members and the interest she earns on her savings.

loan.use: to buy 6 pigs

loan.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Despus de trabajar durante algn tiempo como auxiliar en un Laboratorio, Luis Carlos, decidi crear su propio negocio de empaques plsticos, luego de un tiempo se ide un producto innovador, un dispositivo para suministrar medicamentos a nios, el cual ya patent.
A sus 61 aos de edad, Luis Carlos se considera un gran emprendedor y espera poder comercializar su producto no slo en Colombia sino tambin a nivel internacional y para cumplir su sueo poco a poco, por ahora necesita de un prstamo para comprar insumos para realizar dispositivos y poder iniciar con la comercializacin de dicho producto.
texts.en:
After having worked for some time as a lab assistant, Luis Carlos decided to set up his own business making plastic containers. After a while he had an idea for creating an innovative product, a device for administering medicine to children. He patented his idea.
At 61 years old, Luis Carlos considers himself to be a great entrepreneur and he hopes to be able to sell his product not only in Colombia but also internationally. He hopes to gradually fulfil his dream. For now, he needs a loan to buy supplies for making his devices so that he can start selling his product.

loan.use: to buy supplies for making devices for administering medicine to children

loan.name: Vicuas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. VICUAS DE ORO iniciar su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, est compuesta por seis integrantes y est dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la seora Claudina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociacin comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Comedera, tejido de mantas, venta de espejos, albail, carpintera, produccin de chicharrones.
La seora Claudina, indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer y que integro la institucin por invitacin de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de comida que inicio desde hace dos aos, el que aprendi de su madre.
El crdito que ahora sacar es para la compra aumentar su capital (compra de fideos, azcar, arroz, etc.) que comprar por mayor de la Ceja y 16 de Julio y que posterior a la elaboracin lo vender en una parada de minibus. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qu le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitacin en crdito y salud.
texts.en:
The Vicuas de Oro (Golden Vicuas) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center. It has six members led by a governing board headed by Claudina. The members are engaged in a variety of businesses. Among them are: eatery, blanket weaving, mirror sales, bricklaying, carpentry and fried pork production.
Claudina indicates that this is the first time shes worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters. She currently has a business selling food that she started two years ago and that she learned from her mother.
The loan shell take out now is to increase capital; she will purchase noodles, rice, sugar, etc. at wholesale in La Ceja and 16 de Julio market. Once she makes the food shell sell it at a minibus stop. This way of working allows her to generate family income because shes single and has three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the credit and health training.

loan.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, etc.

loan.name: Ayde

texts.es: Ayde es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 aos de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos an estudiando. Estudi hasta la secundaria. Desde hace seis aos trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su prstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirti en su negocio de venta de truchas (criadero de truchas), tambin se dedica a la produccin y venta de alimentos. Con ste nuevo prstamo de S/.1200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertir en la compra de seis sacos de alimentos para las truchas como nalchet, purina y otros. Cada ocho meses los vende en Pomata. En el negocio de venta de comida le ayuda su mam y su esposo se encarga del criadero de truchas. Su sueo es tener una buena casa y darles estudios a sus hijos para que sean profesionales. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del prstamo, los ahorros, la utilidad que genera el ahorro y el prstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Ayde is a member of the Communal Bank Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medallion) which is located in the District of Pomata, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children in school. Ayde has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for six years. Her previous loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling farm-raised trout. She also prepares and sells food.
